property.short: Enables the Visual Interface debugging stuff in the client.

description.db:para: This properties enabled various debugging functionalities of the visual interface modules. For example will this switch enable a small icon in the toolbar that allows you to reload the file when it was edited in the IDE.

property.short: Allow caching the IP address that was looked up from the hostname

description.db:para: If this setting is set to true then the connection will keep the IP address it got from looking up the DNS name and re-use it without querying the DNS again.

Caching the value might bring a quicker re-connect, since the DNS lookup can be skipped for following connects. However is also means that if the IP address of a hostname changes the connection is unable to detect the change.
If an IP address is specified for connecting, this setting is irrelevant.

A default fallback which string interner type to use

description.db:para: This value defines the default string interner to use when no specific one is set. The default is unset, so the implementation specific default will be used. This property simply allows to override all internal defaults at once.

The possible values are:
weak A weak reference interner. It will hold the items as long as they are not garbage collected.
strong A string reference interner. It will hold the items forever.
java Will use the java String.intern method.
If the value is unknown or undefined then no string interning will take place.
